alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Muskogee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 13 at 7:55AM CDT until April 13 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... McIntosh County in southeastern Oklahoma... Central Muskogee County in east central Oklahoma... Southeastern Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... * Until 845 AM CDT. * At 754 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Henryetta to 5 miles southeast of Dustin, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Eufaula... Henryetta... Checotah... Dewar... Oktaha... Grayson... Council Hill... Hanna... Rentiesville... Hoffman... Stidham... Raiford... Vivian... Lake Eufaula State Park... Hitchita... Vernon... Pierce... Onapa... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 239 and 274. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
